intro: Piqueria peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian piqueria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Piqueria peruviana is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
